results.title: The Wacol story
results.creator_credit: Department of Commercial and Industrial Development, Queensland and Film Production Associates
results.brief_description: Looks at Queensland’s first Crown Industrial Estate at Wacol. Commenced in 1967 and situated 12 miles from Brisbane near the satellite township of Inala, the estate which was designed to meet the needs of industry, has expanded rapidly. The central location has added to the success of Wacol, and future industrial decentralisation is planned by the Government.

results.title: The Voice of the organ. No. 4
results.brief_description: Community hymn singing - hymns are sung by the choir of HMS Woolverstone whilst an unseen narrator encourages the audience to join in. The words are displayed on illustrated cards. At the organ, Fredric Bayco.

results.title: The Visitor
results.brief_description: The Visitor is a dramatisation of Ray Bradbury’s science fiction short story. “Blood Rust” victims are exiled to the barren deserts of a quarantine planet to prevent spread of disease on Earth. When a new arrival at the distant colony displays a mystical ability to recreate memories of Earth in the minds of the outcasts, his gift becomes the target of envy and aggression.

results.title: The Unknown Eiffel
results.creator_credit: Joan Laskoff and Lennox Art Group
results.brief_description: Biography of Alexandre Gustave Eiffel whoo pioneered metal construction techniques, including prefabrication. Shows some of his most famous works, quotations from Eiffel’s own writings, drawings and plans and contemporary paintings and drawings are used throughout.
results.description: Biography of Alexandre Gustave Eiffel whoo pioneered metal construction techniques, including prefabrication. Shows some of his most famous works, quotations from Eiffel’s own writings, drawings and plans and contemporary paintings and drawings are used throughout.

results.title: The United Nations and world disputes
results.brief_description: Excerpts from newsreels presenting the role of the United Nations in settling disputes in four countries between 1945 and 1950: the Dutch and the new Republic of Indonesia; the Kashmir conflict between India and Pakistan; Count Bernadotte’s and Dr Ralph Bunche’s mediation in Palestine; and the intervention of the United Nations in Korea resulting in a peaceful settlement of hostilities.

results.title: The Unemployed
results.brief_description: A selection of the newsreel coverage of unemployment in Britain during the years 1930-1936. Shows Sir Oswald Mosley speaking in May 1930 on the ineffectiveness of politicans in terms of the unemployment crisis. Covers the three Hunger Marches organized by the National Unemployed Workers Movement in 1932, 1934 and 1936.Presents official responses to unemployment such as the British Medical Association’s advice on nutrition and diet when living on the dole, the Government Loans Scheme which enabled shipbuilding to recommence at Clydeside, the Land Settlement Scheme and the Royal Tours of unemployed areas.

results.title: The Uncalculated risk
results.creator_credit: Filmspace Productions and Russ Nichols Productions
results.brief_description: Shows what can go wrong when inexperienced people head down river in canoes, rafts and kayaks. Stresses that prior instruction is the best means of preventing accidents.
